A UAV patrol system using panoramic stitching and object i)
detection

You Zhou®, Ting Rui?*, Yiran Li, Xuegang Zuo

4 Jiangsu Vocational Institute of Commerce, China
barmy Engineering University of PLA, China

ARTICLE INFO ABSTRACT

Article history: _ Due to their increasing popularity, drones are widely used for security purposes, such as
Received 18 April 2019 patrols, now. There are two key issues in drone patrol: 1) showing the patrolling scene in a
Revised 18 September 2019 simple and intuitive manner; 2) detecting and highlighting objects of interest. To this end,
Accepted 19 September 2019 se ee os . :
; : we propose a UAV patrol system based on panoramic image stitching and object detection.
Available online 24 October 2019 ; . . . . . .
This system uses the SPHP algorithm combined with the region growing algorithm based
Keywords: on difference images to generate a panorama image and to eliminate motion ghosts. It fur-
Motion ghost elimination ther adopts the popular image object detector Faster RCNN to detect objects while using
Object detection knowledge about the scene categories to refine the classification scores of the objects. The
Panoramic stitching proposed system is evaluated on the VisDrone video detection dataset. The experiments
Scene parsing show that the system provides good results regarding panoramic stitching and object de-
UAV patrol tection in drone videos.
